column4: Hello All, wondering if someone could help me. I am trying to install Ubuntu on my laptop and have created a USB bootable, however just discovered my bios does not support USB booting. Figured Id make a CD but the CD drive is not being detected, powers up and ejects etc just isnt shown on the PC
1. enter bios and 100% confirm the boot order is there for cd and usb.  also confirm the BIOS sees the CDrom
if you don't have any luck at all, you can install ubuntu to that hdd by removing it.. and either use another laptop with that hdd or a usb > 2.5" adapter
yet another way is if you can boot over ethernet.
if you have another computer available up and running you can install over ethernet
google for install ubuntu over ethernet
yeh ive got a windows netbook
ive never done this install method in ubuntu before myself. just years ago with redhat or something
ok so if I ethernet up the two Laptops and choose to boot some LAN on the one I want Ubuntu on how will the PC boot?
hang on. ill dig around for ya
can you go to a private room?
you got some reading ahead of you
